post.summary: CancelProposal defines a method to cancel governance proposal
Deposit defines a method to add deposit on a specific proposal.

ExecLegacyContent defines a Msg to be in included in a MsgSubmitProposal
to execute a legacy content-based proposal.
SubmitProposal defines a method to create new proposal given the messages.

UpdateParams defines a governance operation for updating the x/gov module
parameters. The authority is defined in the keeper.
Vote defines a method to add a vote on a specific proposal.

VoteWeighted defines a method to add a weighted vote on a specific
proposal.

cosmos.base.v1beta1.Coin.description:
Coin defines a token with a denomination and an amount.

NOTE: The amount field is an Int which implements the custom method
signatures required by gogoproto.

proposal_id.description: proposal_id defines the unique id of the proposal.

proposer.description: proposer is the account address of the proposer.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgCancelProposal.description: MsgCancelProposal is the Msg/CancelProposal request type.

proposal_id.description: proposal_id defines the unique id of the proposal.

canceled_time.description: canceled_time is the time when proposal is canceled.

canceled_height.description: canceled_height defines the block height at which the proposal is canceled.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgCancelProposalResponse.description:
MsgCancelProposalResponse defines the response structure for executing a
MsgCancelProposal message.

proposal_id.description: proposal_id defines the unique id of the proposal.

depositor.description: depositor defines the deposit addresses from the proposals.

amount.description: amount to be deposited by depositor.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgDeposit.description: MsgDeposit defines a message to submit a deposit to an existing proposal.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgDepositResponse.description: MsgDepositResponse defines the Msg/Deposit response type.

authority.description: authority must be the gov module address.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgExecLegacyContent.description:
MsgExecLegacyContent is used to wrap the legacy content field into a message.
This ensures backwards compatibility with v1beta1.MsgSubmitProposal.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgExecLegacyContentRespon.description: MsgExecLegacyContentResponse defines the Msg/ExecLegacyContent response type.

messages.description: messages are the arbitrary messages to be executed if proposal passes.

initial_deposit.description:
initial_deposit is the deposit value that must be paid at proposal
submission.

proposer.description: proposer is the account address of the proposer.

metadata.description: metadata is any arbitrary metadata attached to the proposal.

title.description: title is the title of the proposal.

summary.title: summary is the summary of the proposal

expedited.title: expedited defines if the proposal is expedited or not

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgSubmitProposal.description:
MsgSubmitProposal defines an sdk.Msg type that supports submitting arbitrary
proposal Content.

proposal_id.description: proposal_id defines the unique id of the proposal.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgSubmitProposalResponse.description: MsgSubmitProposalResponse defines the Msg/SubmitProposal response type.

authority.description:
authority is the address that controls the module (defaults to x/gov unless
overwritten).

params.description:
params defines the x/gov parameters to update.

NOTE: All parameters must be supplied.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgUpdateParams.description: MsgUpdateParams is the Msg/UpdateParams request type.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgUpdateParamsResponse.description:
MsgUpdateParamsResponse defines the response structure for executing a
MsgUpdateParams message.

proposal_id.description: proposal_id defines the unique id of the proposal.

voter.description: voter is the voter address for the proposal.

metadata.description: metadata is any arbitrary metadata attached to the Vote.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgVote.description: MsgVote defines a message to cast a vote.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgVoteResponse.description: MsgVoteResponse defines the Msg/Vote response type.

proposal_id.description: proposal_id defines the unique id of the proposal.

voter.description: voter is the voter address for the proposal.

options.description: options defines the weighted vote options.

metadata.description: metadata is any arbitrary metadata attached to the VoteWeighted.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgVoteWeighted.description: MsgVoteWeighted defines a message to cast a vote.

cosmos.gov.v1.MsgVoteWeightedResponse.description: MsgVoteWeightedResponse defines the Msg/VoteWeighted response type.

min_deposit.description: Minimum deposit for a proposal to enter voting period.

max_deposit_period.description:
Maximum period for Atom holders to deposit on a proposal. Initial value: 2
months.

quorum.description:
Minimum percentage of total stake needed to vote for a result to be
 considered valid.

threshold.description: Minimum proportion of Yes votes for proposal to pass. Default value: 0.5.

veto_threshold.description:
Minimum value of Veto votes to Total votes ratio for proposal to be
 vetoed. Default value: 1/3.

min_initial_deposit_ratio.description:
The ratio representing the proportion of the deposit value that must be
 paid at proposal submission.

proposal_cancel_ratio.description:
The cancel ratio which will not be returned back to the depositors when a
proposal is cancelled.

proposal_cancel_dest.description:
The address which will receive (proposal_cancel_ratio * deposit) proposal
deposits. If empty, the (proposal_cancel_ratio * deposit) proposal deposits
will be burned.

expedited_voting_period.description: Duration of the voting period of an expedited proposal.

expedited_threshold.description: Minimum proportion of Yes votes for proposal to pass. Default value: 0.67.

expedited_min_deposit.description: Minimum expedited deposit for a proposal to enter voting period.

burn_vote_quorum.title: burn deposits if a proposal does not meet quorum

burn_proposal_deposit_prevote.title: burn deposits if the proposal does not enter voting period

burn_vote_veto.title: burn deposits if quorum with vote type no_veto is met

min_deposit_ratio.description:
The ratio representing the proportion of the deposit value minimum that
must be met when making a deposit. Default value: 0.01. Meaning that for a
chain with a min_deposit of 100stake, a deposit of 1stake would be
required.

cosmos.gov.v1.Params.description: Params defines the parameters for the x/gov module.

cosmos.gov.v1.VoteOption.description:
VoteOption enumerates the valid vote options for a given governance proposal.

 - VOTE_OPTION_UNSPECIFIED: VOTE_OPTION_UNSPECIFIED defines a no-op vote option.
 - VOTE_OPTION_YES: VOTE_OPTION_YES defines a yes vote option.
 - VOTE_OPTION_ABSTAIN: VOTE_OPTION_ABSTAIN defines an abstain vote option.
 - VOTE_OPTION_NO: VOTE_OPTION_NO defines a no vote option.
 - VOTE_OPTION_NO_WITH_VETO: VOTE_OPTION_NO_WITH_VETO defines a no with veto vote option.

option.description:
option defines the valid vote options, it must not contain duplicate vote
options.

weight.description: weight is the vote weight associated with the vote option.

cosmos.gov.v1.WeightedVoteOption.description: WeightedVoteOption defines a unit of vote for vote split.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.
